title: ICE: `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value in `check_attr.rs`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
This is a fuzzed test case, found with [tree-splicer](https://github.com/langston-barrett/tree-splicer) and minimized with [`treereduce`](https://github.com/langston-barrett/treereduce). I hope it's valid, please let me know (and many apologies) if it's not helpful! I searched the issue tracker [like so](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3AI-ICE+option+unwrap+none+check_attr), and did not find any related issues. I was able to reproduce with a compiler I compiled from 7b4f48927dce585f747a58083b45ab62b9d73a53. ### Code ```Rust #![doc(test(""))] ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (ff4b772f8 2023-03-10) binary: rustc commit-hash: ff4b772f805ec1e1c1bd7e189ab8d5a4e3a6ef13 commit-date: 2023-03-10 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_passes/src/check_attr.rs:971:57 ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_passes/src/check_attr.rs:971:57 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7efcc0ed451a - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::libunwind::trace::hdf463920cb9883c6 at /rustc/ff4b772f805ec1e1c1bd7e189ab8d5a4e3a6ef13/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:93:5 1: 0x7efcc0ed451a -
